comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: Jerome Napoleon Charles Bonaparte (1878-1945), son of Jerome Napoleon Bonaparte II (1830 – 1893) and Caroline Le Roy Appleton Edgar (1840-1911). Married Blanche Pierce Stenbeigh (1872-1950) in 1914. The bigger news in 1914 was Jerome Bonaparte - an American - was, for a while, in line to rise to the head of France's Imperialist Party (the party seeking the restoration of the Monarchy in France). But alas, such a possibility was dashed by the birth of Louis, Prince Napoléon (1914-1997) to Victor, Prince Napoléon (1862-1926) and Princess Clémentine of Belgium (1872-1955) on January 23, 1914. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0D14F7345F13738... HEIR TO BONAPARTIST PRETENDER ENDS AMERICAN HOPES New York Times February 8, 1914 PRINCESS CLEMENTINE of Belgium, by presenting her husband, Prince Victor Bonaparte, with a son and heir the other day at Brussels, has rendered more remote, if indeed she has not removed altogether, the possibility of an American citizen becoming the candidate of the Imperialist Party in France, for a restoration of the monarchy on the banks of the Seine. NOTE: Jerome Bonaparte is also the step-brother of Commander Webster A. Edgar (USN), who was featured in the last round of Bain/LOC photos. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5285332949/]

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: TVL1970:  Thank you for the information about Jerome Bonaparte and the New York Times article with a similar photo of him.  We will add some of the information to the description when we update the database.
